sentences: Eduardo Teixeira da Fonseca Vasconcellos, known as Eduardo "Edu" Falaschi (born May 18, 1972), is a Brazilian musician.
He is also noted for his solo band Almah, which started as a side project featuring a number of guest musicians and is now his main and only band.
When he was one year old, Falaschi's parents moved to Rio de Janeiro, where he lived until the age of 12.
section: == Early life and first musical experiences ==

sentences: By the time he was 14 years old, he was taking guitar lessons, and his interest in music increased.
section: == Early life and first musical experiences ==

sentences: He played the drums for six months in a blues band with his friends, and he also played bass and guitar and sang backing vocals in a cover band.
section: == Early life and first musical experiences ==

sentences: In 1989, he was invited by school friends to join a band as a singer to play at a music contest.
section: == Early life and first musical experiences ==

sentences: Subsequently, in 1990, some of the band members decided to form Mitrium, a rock band, in which they played their own compositions.
section: == Early life and first musical experiences ==

sentences: In 1991, they recorded their first demo tape with the song "Just Remember".
In 1994, the heavy metal band Iron Maiden was looking for a new singer through an international contest sponsored by the band, resulting in thousands of tapes being sent in by would-be rock stars.

In spite of the professional career success, on August 5, 1994 Falaschi was forced to leave Mitrium due to personal problems, but he kept playing just for fun with his friends, and later recorded a demo, with eight simple rock n' roll songs with a band called Opium.
Falaschi decided to take a break for almost four years.
section: == Career with Symbols, Angra and Almah ==

sentences: In the middle of 1998, he was invited by the band Symbols to produce their first album.
section: == Career with Symbols, Angra and Almah ==

sentences: In 2000, Symbols released their second album, called Call to the End.
section: == Career with Symbols, Angra and Almah ==

sentences: The Brazilian band Angra was looking for new members, and after a trial among other vocalists, Falaschi was invited to join the band in 2000.
section: == Career with Symbols, Angra and Almah ==

sentences: As in 2012, Falaschi left Angra due to health issues and problems within the band.
section: == Career with Symbols, Angra and Almah ==

sentences: In 2006, under the project name Almah, he released his first solo album, self-titled.
section: == Career with Symbols, Angra and Almah ==

sentences: In 2008, as a full band, Almah released their second album, Fragile Equality.
section: == Career with Symbols, Angra and Almah ==

sentences: Falaschi performed poorly at Rock in Rio 2011, after which he started his treatment.
He talked about this problems in an interview for a Russian website in 2012:
It was only a few years later when I found out that the problem was with the acid.
Nowadays my voice is OK, and this is very nice.
I can sing Angra songs normally again, as I did in 2001 and 2002.
